summary: A layered day of emotional and strategic self-inquiry. Explored internal conviction about being exceptional — emotionally and logically — and questioned whether it's grounded or delusional. Came out with stronger confidence in inner truth, but also recognized hidden entitlement. Parallelly, re-evaluated AI-focused roles and job paths; rejected shallow job opportunities not aligned with deep creative or systems thinking. The day rebalanced identity with ambition, truth with patience, and ego with output.

wins: Reaffirmed that emotional sharpness and logical clarity are not delusions — they are under-leveraged assets.
Didn’t numb or distract when deeper self-worth questions arose; stayed in the ring.
Filtered AI job listings not for comfort, but for alignment — rejected dopamine-chasing roles.
losses: Mild frustration at lack of immediate role-fit in AI space — temptation to feel 'underutilized'.
Caught subtle internal resentment about progress speed — a form of disguised entitlement.
Energy dipped post-momentum — still adjusting to the work-life intensity mix.
ideas: Create a heuristic to evaluate AI roles: logic density, real-world leverage, identity alignment.
Start prototyping mini-LLM tools again — solo mode — with no audience in mind.
Accept discomfort as rent paid by those who are 1-in-10,000 — and act accordingly.

goals: Build or ship *something* solo this week — even small but real. Output > overthinking.
Create a short list of ‘acceptable roles’ and mark must-have conditions for alignment.
Anchor this clarity emotionally — no need to wait for another breakdown to remember it.
triggerEvents: Reflection on Dostoevsky quote about self-lies and resentment loops.
Reviewed and rejected low-leverage AI job role on LinkedIn.
Realized internal resistance wasn’t laziness but deep alignment filter kicking in.
symptomChecklist: Mild performance anxiety while browsing job roles.
No manic tendencies, but noticeable intensity spikes during identity reflection.
Emotional fatigue post insight loop — common after heavy truth days.
